intro: Calvaria borbonica, commonly known as the Madagascar star-flower, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
